<!-- Tier-specific guidance -->

::: {.content-visible when-meta="tier: 1"}
### Tier 1 Notes

Your single-donor build uses belt-driven Z. This means:

- One Z motor drives both Z rods via belt
- Simpler wiring (only 4 stepper drivers needed)
- Manual bed leveling required (no auto-tram)
- Good starting point for learning
:::

::: {.content-visible when-meta="tier: 2"}
### Tier 2 Notes

Your dual-donor build uses Triple-Z. This means:

- Three independent Z motors for auto bed leveling
- Multi-MCU setup (two boards working together)
- Klipper's Z_TILT_ADJUST handles bed tramming
- More complex, but superior leveling
:::

::: {.content-visible when-meta="tier: 3"}
### Tier 3 Notes (Reference Spec)

Your reference spec build uses MKS SKIPR with integrated host. This means:

- No separate Raspberry Pi needed
- 6 stepper drivers in one board
- CAN bus ready for future expansion
- Triple-Z with Klipper auto-leveling
:::
